description.narrative: GGF funds will support Mining Watch Canada's efforts to strengthen local organizations in Peru and Ecuador through collaborative research, support for local self determination initiatives and better communication between Mining Watch Canada and its partner organizations. In Peru, it will partner with Cooperaccion, a Lima based organization, to monitor and analyze Canadian sponsored mining initiatives. Additionally, Cooperaccion will assist a local community undertake corporate research and bring attention to a proposed copper mine by HudBay Minerals, which is seeking to assert territorial control over local lands. In Ecuador, Mining Watch Canada will work with the Ecumenical Commission for Human Rights (CEDHU) and the People's Assembly of the South to strengthen Canadian solidarity with their struggle against criminalization of dissent and in defense of land, water, and food sovereignty in the context of the development of new large mining projects in the Southern Amazon.
